UploadedFile.title: UploadedFile
UploadedFile.description: Represents a file uploaded by a user for statistical analysis.

id.description: Unique identifier for the uploaded file.

userId.description: Reference to the User who uploaded this file. (Relationship: User 1:N UploadedFile)

fileName.description: The original name of the uploaded file.

uploadDate.description: The date and time when the file was uploaded.

fileType.description: The type of the uploaded file (e.g., CSV, TXT).

fileSize.description: The size of the uploaded file in bytes.

dataColumns.description: List of columns in the file.

StatisticalAnalysis.title: StatisticalAnalysis
StatisticalAnalysis.description: Represents the statistical analysis performed on an uploaded file.

id.description: Unique identifier for the statistical analysis.

uploadedFileId.description: Reference to the UploadedFile that this analysis is based on. (Relationship: UploadedFile 1:N StatisticalAnalysis)

mean.description: The mean (average) value of the data.

median.description: The median value of the data.

standardDeviation.description: The standard deviation of the data.

minimum.description: The minimum value in the data.

maximum.description: The maximum value in the data.

DataVisualization.title: DataVisualization
DataVisualization.description: Represents a visualization (chart/graph) generated from the data.

id.description: Unique identifier for the data visualization.

uploadedFileId.description: Reference to the UploadedFile this visualization is based on. (Relationship: UploadedFile 1:N DataVisualization)

chartType.description: The type of chart or graph (e.g., histogram, box plot, scatter plot).

chartData.description: The data used to generate the chart (e.g., JSON, CSV).

labels.description: Labels associated with data points in the chart.

CorrelationAnalysis.title: CorrelationAnalysis
CorrelationAnalysis.description: Represents the correlation analysis performed on an uploaded file.

id.description: Unique identifier for the correlation analysis.

uploadedFileId.description: Reference to the UploadedFile that this analysis is based on. (Relationship: UploadedFile 1:N CorrelationAnalysis)

correlationMatrix.description: The correlation matrix data (e.g., JSON, CSV).

variables.description: The names of the variables used in the correlation analysis.

SummaryReport.title: SummaryReport
SummaryReport.description: Represents a summary report generated for a given dataset.

id.description: Unique identifier for the summary report.

uploadedFileId.description: Reference to the UploadedFile this report is based on. (Relationship: UploadedFile 1:N SummaryReport)

reportData.description: The content of the summary report (e.g., text, HTML).

creationDate.description: The date and time when the report was generated.

format.description: The file format of the report (e.g., PDF, TXT).

User.description: Represents a user of the application.

registrationDate.description: The date and time when the user registered.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to ensure data isolation and efficient querying by leveraging path-based ownership. Each user has their own dedicated space for uploaded files and associated analysis data. This design promotes authorization independence by avoiding the need for `get()` calls in security rules, enabling atomic operations and simplifying debugging.

The structure follows a hierarchical pattern: `/users/{userId}/uploads/{uploadId}` for uploaded files, and subcollections for statistical analysis, data visualizations, correlation analyses, and summary reports. This approach allows for secure list operations (QAPs) as all documents within a user's path are owned by that user, simplifying security rule logic. Denormalization is not strictly required here as we're leveraging the user-centric path ownership, which implicitly grants access based on the user's ID.
